parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name/>=<value> effect

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Broken Commands

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set system of units. This will only impact gauges from advanced flight model.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>This command is buggy: any value other than 0 (metric) will display both units at the same time.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[setSystemOfUnits]] value

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] - possible values are:<br><comment><!-- <br> instead of * list because of a Return value title display bug --></comment>
0 - metric<br>
1 - mixed<br>
2 - imperial

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[player]] [[in]] _myHelicopter) [[then]] { [[setSystemOfUnits]] 2; };</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Description.ext#forceRotorLibSimulation|forceRotorLibSimulation]], [[Advanced Helicopter Flight Model in Arma3|Advanced Helicopter Flight Model]], [[:Category:Command_Group:_RTD|RotorLib commands]] [[systemOfUnits]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>New Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
